metadata.title: CVE-2021-36085 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a use-after-free in __cil_verify_classperms (called from __verify_map_perm_classperms and hashtab_map). sbeattie> AppArmor is the default LSM in Ubuntu, issue only affects   compilation of selinux policy sbeattie> trusty version predates the introduction of CIL

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-36085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsepol1 - 3.1-1ubuntu2.1
sepol-utils - 3.1-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsepol package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu2.1').
